metadata.source: Brevard County eLaws (cached from web search)
metadata.note: eLaws was unavailable (503), data from cached search results

ordinances.name: Single-family residential, RU-1-9
ordinances.description: The RU-1-9 single-family residential zoning classification encompasses lands devoted to single-family residential development of spacious character, together with such accessory uses as may be necessary or are normally compatible with residential surroundings.
permitted_uses: Group homes, level I, subject to the requirements set forth in section 62-1835.9
Power substations, telephone exchanges and transmission facilities
Temporary living quarters during construction of a residence

ordinances.name: Single-family residential, RU-1-13
ordinances.description: The RU-1-13 and RU-1-11 single-family residential zoning classifications encompass lands devoted to single-family residential development of spacious character, together with such accessory uses as may be necessary or are normally compatible with residential surroundings.
permitted_uses: Group homes, level I, subject to the requirements set forth in section 62-1835.9
Power substations, telephone exchanges and transmission facilities
Temporary living quarters during construction of a residence

ordinances.name: Single-family residential, RU-1-11
ordinances.description: The RU-1-13 and RU-1-11 single-family residential zoning classifications encompass lands devoted to single-family residential development of spacious character, together with such accessory uses as may be necessary or are normally compatible with residential surroundings.
permitted_uses: Group homes, level I, subject to the requirements set forth in section 62-1835.9
Power substations, telephone exchanges and transmission facilities
Temporary living quarters during construction of a residence

ordinances.name: Environmental areas, EA
ordinances.description: The EA environmental area zoning classification recognizes the natural resource components as defined and provided for by the provisions of the conservation element of the comprehensive plan. The purpose is to conserve natural resource functions and features by retaining lands and waters in their pristine character and condition, but permit uses which are compatible with or which shall enhance or restore the functions and features of such natural resources.
permitted_uses: Group homes, level I, subject to the requirements set forth in section 62-1835.9

ordinances.name: Single-family residential, RU-1-7
ordinances.description: The RU-1-7 single-family residential zoning classification encompasses lands devoted to single-family residential development of spacious character, together with such accessory uses as may be necessary or are normally compatible with residential surroundings.
permitted_uses: Power substations, telephone exchanges and transmission facilities

ordinances.name: Rural residential, RR-1
ordinances.description: The RR-1 rural residential zoning classification encompasses lands devoted to single-family residential development at rural densities of one dwelling unit per acre, together with agricultural uses and such accessory uses as are normally compatible with rural residential surroundings.
permitted_uses: Keeping of horses (4 per acre max, 10,000 sf per animal)

ordinances.name: Agricultural residential, AU
ordinances.description: The AU agricultural residential zoning classification is intended to provide for agricultural activities and single-family residential development at very low densities.

ordinances.name: Retail commercial, BU-1
ordinances.description: The BU-1 retail commercial zoning classification is intended to provide for retail commercial uses which serve the daily shopping needs of the surrounding residential neighborhoods.

ordinances.name: General commercial, BU-2
ordinances.description: The BU-2 general commercial zoning classification provides for a wide range of commercial uses including retail, office, and service uses.

ordinances.name: Planned unit development, PUD
ordinances.description: The PUD planned unit development zoning classification provides for flexibility in the design and development of land in a manner that promotes creative design, preserves natural features, and provides a mix of land uses.
permitted_uses: Uses as specified in approved PUD development order
conditional_uses: As specified in approved PUD development order

ordinances.name: Industrial use, IU
ordinances.description: The IU industrial use zoning classification provides for industrial and manufacturing uses.

ordinances.name: General use, GU
ordinances.description: The GU general use zoning classification is a temporary classification assigned to lands until a more specific zoning classification is established.
conditional_uses: As determined by the zoning official

ordinances.name: Multi-family residential, RU-2-10
ordinances.description: Multi-family residential zoning for up to 10 dwelling units per acre.

ordinances.name: Multi-family residential, RU-2-15
ordinances.description: Multi-family residential zoning for up to 15 dwelling units per acre.

ordinances.name: Multi-family residential, RU-2-30
ordinances.description: High-density multi-family residential zoning for up to 30 dwelling units per acre.

ordinances.name: Suburban residential, SR
ordinances.description: Suburban residential zoning for single-family development at 2 units per acre.

ordinances.name: Tourist resort 1, TR-1
ordinances.description: Tourist resort zoning for hotels, motels, and tourist-oriented commercial uses.
